info.title: CHIPS Authentication via API
info.description:
Exposes authentication of CHIPS users via direct API calls.

# Features 
![Authentication](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Providers/CHIPS/AuthAPI/Authentication.png)
* Authenticate a CHIPS user in order to retrieve a refresh and bearer auth token. 
* Request a new bearer token with the refresh token as authorization. 


![OTP PIN Reset](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Providers/CHIPS/AuthAPI/OTPPINSet.png)
* Send an OTP to a mobile number.
* Reset the CHIPS user PIN.

mobileNumber.description: Mobile number associated with the account requiring the PIN reset. The number must be in international format.

emailAddress.description: Email address associated with the account requiring the PIN reset.

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

post.description:
Request an OTP to be sent to the mobile number or email that is associated with the account. 


<!--
type: tab
title: Mobile OTP
-->



The number will receive an SMS:

```
OTP: xxxxx
Your CHIPS generated verification code
```

<!--
type: tab
title: Email OTP
-->



The following will be sent to the email address.
![OTP Email](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Providers/CHIPS/AuthAPI/CHIPS-EMailOTP.png)


<!-- type: tab-end -->


The OTP can then be used with [POST /chips/auth/api/pin][api-chips-auth-api-pin-post] to reset the CHIPS® account PIN code.




[api-chips-auth-api-pin-post]: swagger.json/paths/~1pin

application.description: Name for your application preferably including the version number.

packageName.description: Java package name or reverse domain name

device.description: Device identifier (Mac, IMEI or self generated) or browser user-agent.

email.description: Email address associated with CHIPS account.

mobileNumber.description: Mobile number assocaited with the CHIPS account. (International format)

post.description: Use the CHIPS user uuid, mobileNumber or email and PIN to authenticate and retrieve a CHIPS Bearer Token

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

get.description: Refresh CHIPS Bearer Token based on previously issued refresh token.
